title: Tidal Bore
comment: A tidal bore moves up Turnagain Arm, an inlet near Anchorage, Alaska. The Arm is about 3 miles wide at this point.

title: Mavericks
comment: Normally the waves at Mavericks are mild, as shown here. After a severe winter storm the waves may reach sizes as high as any in the world. When that happens, big wave surfers from around the world flock here.

title: South and North Beaches
comment: South and North Beaches at Point Reyes, from the lighthouse to Abbot's Lagoon, form a nine mile long, continuous beach front facing the incoming waves. The beaches face to the NW at a bearing of about 300Â°, matching the angle of approach of the waves. As a result the waves directly hit the beach front. Photo taken from the Point Reyes lighthouse.

title: Tsunami
comment: In case of tsunami, go this way.

title: Breaking Waves
location: Gray Whale Cove State Beach, CA
comment: When waves approach shore they slow down, decreasing their wavelength. When the wavelength is 1/7 of what it was in the open ocean, the waves begin to break, spilling over the front side of the wave.
